experience: You and Will both know Scott Swigart, Steven Scott, and 6 others

We design, build, and maintain the core infrastructure used by Stripe’s engineering team. Whether it's debugging production issues across services and levels of the stack, planning for Stripe's growth or building a great customer experience for people using our infrastructure.Join us: https://stripe.com/jobs/positions/infrastructure-engineer !

Led Uber’s Platform Engineering’s people and strategy, growing a small team into a seventy person organization. Our infrastructure ran Uber, and our tools supported Uber’s more than 1,800 engineers.The team’s stability wins transformed Friday nights from terrors to happy hours (resource isolation, capacity planning, alert tuning). Our self-service tooling and automation facilitated the transition from dozens of microservices to over 1,000 (from Puppet/Clusto to Docker/Mesos/Aurora). We migrated from our original datacenter to an international presence.Focused on mentoring managers, hiring, running org-wide efficiency project for engineering costs, while writing and maintaining a few services (Python, Go) to keep the rust away.

(The Digg Engineering team was acquired by SocialCode.)Founded SocialCode’s San Francisco office, and grew the SF engineering team to 14 engineers. We built new products from scratch (AdOptics dashboard for campaign performance; AdVisor tool for Twitter), and took over development of existing products (MessageOptics social media analytics tool).Designed and implemented much of our infrastructure layer, including our data infras- tructure (Kafka, Redshift), continuous deployment (Github, Jenkins, APT), configuration management (Chef), transition to service-oriented architecture (Django, HA- TEOAS), and cross-product user auth(n|z).

Hired and led team of seven infrastructure and UI/UX engineers who were responsible for the entirety of Digg.com, APIs and mobile applications. Contributed code to most features, and was the primary developer on a handful. Worked mostly in Python, PHP and JavaScript.Represented our engineering team and technology assets to potential acquirers, leading to acquisition by the Washington Post Company (now known as Graham Holding)'s SocialCode.

Engineering lead and team lead on a range of projects including implementing our sharded Redis cluster, public APIs, MyNews social news feature and overall caching strategy. Worked primarily in Python, using Cassandra, Redis and MySQL.
Worked on full engineering stack for Yahoo! BOSS product, ranging from the Erlang workflow manager to PHP web servers to JavaScript and CSS for the UI/UX.
Implemented and sold TouchDefense iPhone game on iTunes store.
Prepared and taught English as a Foreign Language at three public schools in rural Japan.

Jonathan Gardner
Senior Engineer
February 29, 2012, Will was senior to Jonathan but didn’t manage directly

When I interviewed with Digg, I wanted to make sure that they had a solid team of engineers with experience and depth. I also wanted to make sure that the lead engineer was able to both "herd cats" and maintain a certain degree of humility.Will is the kind of guy I like working around. He's the ideal engineering manager. Not only is he crazy-smart, but his crazy-smart-ness infects the people around him. When you meet with him and talk about ideas, you come away knowing more about the problems you are working on than you started with, and you have a better grasp of which tools will be the right solution for the problem. Of course, he doesn't know everything, but he knows enough about how to solve problems that he can help you solve your own problems.Will is also a great manager. He knows how to motivate by virtue of his personality. He knows what makes an engineer tick, and he knows when the team is down and has his thumb on what needs to be done to fix it. I know that Will is on our side, and he is carefully listening to our input and advice when he meets with the leadership of the company, and that whatever decisions they come to will be based on accurate information.I can honestly say that Will is the embodiment of the Digg engineering team. I just can't imagine Digg without Will.
Jonathan Gardner

Rich Schumacher
Software Engineer at Curalate
March 7, 2012, Will was senior to Rich but didn’t manage directly

Rich has an uncanny sense for how to find a simple solution to complex technical problems. One of my favorite projects I've worked on at Digg is building a redundant sharded Redis cluster, and Rich turned building that complex system into a tractable and straightforward project. Rich has since moved on to leading the technical side of our Ads platform, but I still go to him frequently to run ideas past him, and for his insight when hard problems have me stumped.

March 7, 2012, Will was senior to Amar but didn’t manage directly

Amar is a passionate advocate for Digg's user experience and the users experiencing it. For each product we come up with, or existing product we tweak, he adds historical context and thoughtful analysis on how we can improve. He's been working in the social media space so long and thought about it so deeply that it's hard to throw any new ideas at him. Getting to work with Amar is one of my favorite parts of working at Digg.
